artist: Louis Henri Sullivan; George Grant Elmslie
description: green with gold letters; rectangular with vertical rectangular element with leaves and organic designs in relief at left
text: Elmslie liked good inside jokes, and this is one of them. He designed this sign for a room where bankers could meet privately with clients, but the font he devised for the lettering reflects his own livelihood. The letter “T” is in the form of a T-square, a traditional drafting tool used by architects—a fixture of his daily work.
title: "Consultation Rooms" sign
